full_title: Used To Be Young by Miley Cyrus
title: Used To Be Young

description.plain:
In “Used To Be Young,” Miley Cyrus looks back on her sometimes wild and crazy past, but not with regret, as most would expect. Instead, the singer is celebrating the many lives she’s lived as they made her who she is today.

Much like the promotion for the first single from Endless Summer Vacation, “Flowers,” Cyrus started teasing Used To Be Young with cryptic posters in various cities around the world with iconic verses from previous singles on August 14th. The following day, all of her YouTube video thumbnails were changed to black and white with the phrase “USED TO BE YOUNG” in them. Then, on August 17th, the singer announced the single on her social media, along with the rerelease of her special Endless Summer Vacation: Continued (Backyard Sessions):

In celebration of my new single release Endless Summer Vacation (backyard sessions) continues. Aug 24th @ 10pm EDT on ABC. This time with a retrospective interview sharing stories about the first 30 years of my life in honor of U2BY. This song is dedicated to my loyal fans. I love YOU for loving every version of ME. Always, Miley
